text:
I am using Windows7 and JDK6. I had created a web application "mak" and deployed mak.war on Tomcat by using Ant. And then I started server, It was working fine.

I had to make some changes on my application. So I made needed changes and generated war file and moved to Tomcat webapps folder by the same ant build. 

The new war file got updated successfully but the folder mak under webapps does not have proper web directory format. WEB_INF was the only folder in mak. All my JSPs and static content got deleted. It does mean that It was not redeployed successfully. 

Moreover, I was getting following information on Console. 

  Apr 30, 2013 3:32:56 PM org.apache.catalina.startup.ExpandWar deleteDir
SEVERE: [D:\mak\Tomcat7\webapps\mak\WEB-INF\lib] could not be completely deleted
. The presence of the remaining files may cause problems
Apr 30, 2013 3:32:56 PM org.apache.catalina.startup.ExpandWar deleteDir
SEVERE: [D:\mak\Tomcat7\webapps\mak\WEB-INF] could not be completely deleted. Th
e presence of the remaining files may cause problems
Apr 30, 2013 3:32:56 PM org.apache.catalina.startup.ExpandWar deleteDir
SEVERE: [D:\mak\Tomcat7\webapps\mak] could not be completely deleted. The presen
ce of the remaining files may cause problems
Apr 30, 2013 3:32:56 PM org.apache.catalina.startup.ExpandWar delete
SEVERE: [D:\mak\Tomcat7\webapps\mak] could not be completely deleted. The presen
ce of the remaining files may cause problems
Apr 30, 2013 3:32:56 PM org.apache.catalina.startup.HostConfig deployWAR

Please let me know any updates.

P.S: The same application working fine on Tomcat 5
creator: makpandian@gmail.com

text: Bugzilla is not a support forum. You have a file locking problem with your application. Please use the users list to resolve it.
creator: markt@apache.org
